column4: anyone having problems with x freezing, keeps doing it to me about 3-5 times a day.
only X or your whole system?
what system is it u are using? im using a toshiba laptop and it also freezes from time to time everthing else just works fine
you know what ati gfx? cause i think there could be the problem. ive got a radeon x200 on my system
So there is no real fix for this freezing bug, will have a look at the gfx card one sec.
lspci said VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon Mobility M6 LY
well i didnt find any soution till now.
well its a diffren gfx card but also the mobility
i have read on the ubuntuforums of people having freezing problems that are running nvida chipsets so ?
i also have the feeling that it freezes faster if im running firefox
Think so but im not sure, i have just finished downloading the debian iso, so i think im going back to debian, this is silly as there seems to be no rush to sort/find/fix the problem/bug whatever.
yes im also pissed off because everything else worked really fine but if the system falways reezes you cant really use it
Real shame i liked ubuntu, but i cannot work in hope that it not going to freeze every hour or two.
so you are switching to debian?
Yup after running ubuntu for about year and a half, i really need to have a stable laptop for next week.
i understand that. tell me if the problem remains ;-)
